Package islands.model

Interface GameModel

All Known Implementing Classes:
GameModelImplementation
public interface GameModel
The game board and associated logic.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    boolean
    canPlay(int row, int col)
    Checks whether a play can be made at the specified row and column, where (0, 0) is the top left cell of the board.
    GameModel
    deepCopy()
    Makes a fully independent "deep" copy of this model sharing none of its data.
    default String

    Gets a string representation of this model showing the colors at each board position.
    int

    Returns the score for the specified color.

    Gets the size of this board (the number of rows or the number of columns).
    boolean
    isGameOver()
    Checks whether the game is over.
    void
    makePlay(int row, int col, TileColor tileColor)
    Plays a piece at the specified row and column if that space is in bounds and unoccupied and the specified color is either TileColor.BLACK or TileColor.WHITE.

  • Method Details

    • getSize

      int getSize()
      Gets the size of this board (the number of rows or the number of columns).
      Returns:
      the width or height of this board

    • canPlay

      boolean canPlay(int row, int col)
      Checks whether a play can be made at the specified row and column, where (0, 0) is the top left cell of the board.
      Parameters:
      row - the row
      col - the column
      Returns:
      true if the position is empty
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the position is out of bounds

    • makePlay

      void makePlay(int row, int col, TileColor tileColor)
      Plays a piece at the specified row and column if that space is in bounds and unoccupied and the specified color is either TileColor.BLACK or TileColor.WHITE.
      Parameters:
      row - the row
      col - the column
      tileColor - the color
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the position is occupied or out of bounds or if the color is TileColor.NONE

    • getScore

      int getScore(TileColor tileColor)
      Returns the score for the specified color.
      Parameters:
      tileColor - the color
      Returns:
      the score for the specified color

    • isGameOver

      boolean isGameOver()
      Checks whether the game is over. There are three ways the game can end:
      1. There is a TileColor.BLACK path between the leftmost and rightmost columns.
      2. There is a TileColor.WHITE path between the topmost and bottommost rows.
      3. All of the cells are occupied.
      Returns:
      true if the game is over, false otherwise

    • deepCopy

      GameModel deepCopy()
      Makes a fully independent "deep" copy of this model sharing none of its data.
      Returns:
      the deep copy of this model

    • getBoardString

      default String getBoardString()
      Gets a string representation of this model showing the colors at each board position. Specifically, each position is represented by a single character, the first character of the TileColor.getName(). These characters appear in the string in row-major order, with a newline character after each row.

      For example, a 2x2 board with a white tile in the upper-left corner and a black tile in the upper-right corner, would be represented as "WB\nnn".

      Returns:
      a string representation of the board position
